page.title: 01Introduction to Beckermet
page.content: Our area is situated on the N.W. coastal strip of Cumbria. To the West is the Irish Sea, with the Isle of Man visible most days, while to the East are the Lake District Mountains with Scafell Pike dominating the skyline. The whole area was affected by the Great Ice Age and as a result the soils are predominantly boulder clays. The R. Ehen traversing the area has deposited fertile alluvium over the centuries, consequently the area has good pasture and arable land. The low lying boggy coastal areas provide rough grazing. Dairy cattle are the dominant live stock while cereal crops are extensively grown. The climate is mild - Winter average 2 Celcius, Summer average 18 Celcius. This is attributed to the effect of the sea which reduces the severity of the winters.
